00020 /** \file
00021  \brief OBD service commands
00022  */
00023 
00024 #include "obdservicecommands.h"
00025 #include <string.h>
00026 #include <stdio.h>
00027 #include <stdlib.h>
00028 
00029 struct obdservicecmd *obdGetCmdForColumn(const char *db_column) {
00030     int i;
00031     int numrows = sizeof(obdcmds_mode1)/sizeof(obdcmds_mode1[0]);
00032     for(i=0;i<numrows;i++) {
00033         struct obdservicecmd *o = &obdcmds_mode1[i];
00034         if(NULL == o->db_column) {
00035             continue;
00036         }
00037 
00038         if(0 == strcmp(db_column,o->db_column)) {
00039             return o;
00040         }
00041     }
00042     return NULL;
00043 }
00044 
00045 /// O(log(n)) PID finder
00046 /** Profiling, it usually ends up slower than the linear one, which is
00047 because we're normally in the lower end of the PID scale and the linear
00048 one is much simpler */
00049 static struct obdservicecmd *obdGetCmdForPID_recursive(const unsigned int pid,
00050     const int first_idx, const int last_idx) {
00051 
00052     // printf("%i %i\n", first_idx, last_idx);
00053 
00054     // const unsigned int first_pid = obdcmds_mode1[first_idx].cmdid;
00055     const unsigned int last_pid = obdcmds_mode1[last_idx].cmdid;
00056 
00057     // if(pid == first_pid) return &obdcmds_mode1[first_idx];
00058     if(pid == last_pid) return &obdcmds_mode1[last_idx];
00059 
00060     if(first_idx >= last_idx) {
00061         return NULL;
00062     }
00063 
00064     int middle_idx = (last_idx + first_idx)/2;
00065     const unsigned int middle_pid = obdcmds_mode1[middle_idx].cmdid;
00066 
00067     if(pid == middle_pid) return &obdcmds_mode1[middle_idx];
00068 
00069     if(middle_pid < pid) {
00070         return obdGetCmdForPID_recursive(pid, middle_idx+1, last_idx-1);
00071     } else {
00072         return obdGetCmdForPID_recursive(pid, first_idx, middle_idx-1);
00073     }
00074 }
00075 
00076 struct obdservicecmd *obdGetCmdForPID(const unsigned int pid) {
00077     int i;
00078     int numrows = sizeof(obdcmds_mode1)/sizeof(obdcmds_mode1[0]);
00079     for(i=0;i<numrows;i++) {
00080         struct obdservicecmd *o = &obdcmds_mode1[i];
00081 
00082         if(pid == o->cmdid) {
00083             return o;
00084         }
00085     }
00086     return NULL;
00087 
00088     // return obdGetCmdForPID_recursive(pid, 0, sizeof(obdcmds_mode1)/sizeof(obdcmds_mode1[0]));
00089 }
00090 
00091 int obderrconvert_r(char *buf, int n, unsigned int A, unsigned int B) {
00092     unsigned int partcode = (A>>4)&0x0F;
00093     unsigned int numbercode = 0;
00094     char strpartcode;
00095     switch(partcode) {
00096             // Powertrain codes
00097         case 0x00:
00098         case 0x01:
00099         case 0x02:
00100         case 0x03:
00101             strpartcode = 'P';
00102             numbercode = partcode;
00103             break;
00104             
00105             // Chassis codes
00106         case 0x04:
00107         case 0x05:
00108         case 0x06:
00109         case 0x07:
00110             strpartcode = 'C';
00111             numbercode = partcode-4;
00112             break;
00113             
00114             // Body codes
00115         case 0x08:
00116         case 0x09:
00117         case 0x0A:
00118         case 0x0B:
00119             strpartcode = 'B';
00120             numbercode = partcode-8;
00121             break;
00122             
00123             // Network codes
00124         case 0x0C:
00125         case 0x0D:
00126         case 0x0E:
00127         case 0x0F:
00128             strpartcode = 'U';
00129             numbercode = partcode-12;
00130             break;
00131             
00132         default:
00133             fprintf(stderr, "Could not decode error code.\n");
00134             return 0;
00135             break;
00136     }
00137     
00138     return snprintf(buf, n, "%c%u%01X%02X", strpartcode, numbercode, A&0x0F, B);
00139 }
00140 
00141 const char *obderrconvert(unsigned int A, unsigned int B) {
00142     static char strerr[6]; // Letter, four digits, \0
00143     strerr[0] = '\0';
00144     
00145     obderrconvert_r(strerr, sizeof(strerr), A, B);
00146     
00147     return strerr;
00148 }
